   By Julie Kliegman March 26, 2014

Barbara Boxer says more than half of women use birth control to treat other
conditions

   As the U.S. Supreme Court heard oral arguments in the Hobby Lobby case
   regarding the Affordable Care Act’s free birth control provision, there’s
   no shortage of discourse on abortions, emergency contraception and yes,
   even penis pumps.

"And it’s important to note that women take birth control, more than half
   of them, as a medication for other conditions, so it is an attack on
   women."

Guttmacher
   says 58 percent of women on the pill take it for noncontraceptive reasons.
